contextId.information: This can be stated in an active form. AT: "Someone invited Jesus and his disciples to the wedding" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Jesus and his disciples were invited to the wedding

contextId.information: This can be stated in an active form. AT: "someone had written" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it was written

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "John was baptizing them" or "he was baptizing them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: were being baptized

contextId.information: This can be stated in an active form for clarity. AT: "Then John's disciples and a Jew began to argue" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Then there arose a dispute between some of John's disciples and a Jew

contextId.information: This can be stated in an active form. AT: "God sent me to arrive before him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I have been sent before him

contextId.information: This can be translated in an active form. AT: "when the angel moves the water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when the water is stirred up

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "so God can save you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that you might be saved

contextId.information: This is a passive statement that can be translated in an active form. AT: "The prophets wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is written in the prophets

contextId.information: This is a passive phrase. You may translate it in an active form with a personal subject. AT: "Moses wrote" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it is written

contextId.information: This is a passive statement. You can translate it in an active form. AT: "no one has ever heard of anyone who healed a man who was blind from birth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it has never been heard that anyone opened

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "whom they called Didymus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: who was called Didymus

contextId.information: A burial custom of this time was to wrap the dead body with long strips of linen cloth. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Someone had wrapped strips of cloth around his hands and feet. They had also tied a cloth around his face" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: his feet and hands were bound with cloths, and his face was bound about with a cloth

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "when God glorified Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when Jesus was glorified

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "in order to fulfill the message of Isaiah the prophet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that the word of Isaiah the prophet would be fulfilled

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "so people would not stop them from going to the synagogue" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that they would not be banned from the synagogue

contextId.information: Here "bless" means to cause good, beneficial things to happen to a person. You can translate this in an active form. AT: "God will bless you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you are blessed

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "Now people are about to see how the Son of Man will receive honor and how God will receive honor through what the Son of Man is doing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in him

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "my Father will love anyone who loves me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he who loves me will be loved by my Father

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "the fire burns them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they are burned up

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "he will do it for you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will be done for you

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "It causes people to honor my Father" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: My Father is glorified in this

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "to fulfill the prophecy in their law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to fulfill the word that is written in their law

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "others will scatter you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: you will be scattered

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "so that you can unite them just as you have united us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that they will be one, just as we are one

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "Now the high priest knew that disciple so he was able to enter with Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and he entered with Jesus

contextId.information: This is a special stone platform where only the important people were allowed to go. You can translate this in an active form. AT: "in a place the people called The Pavement," (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: in a place called "The Pavement,"

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "to the place that the people called 'The Place of a Skull,'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to the place called "The Place of a Skull,"

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "the place where the soldiers crucified Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the place where Jesus was crucified

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "he knew that he had done everything that God had sent him to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: knowing that everything was now completed

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "to break the legs of the executed men and take their bodies down from the crosses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to break their legs and to remove them

contextId.information: This is a quotation from Psalm 34. You can translate this in an active form. AT: "No one will break any of his bones" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Not one of his bones will be broken

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "she saw that someone had rolled away the stone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: she saw the stone rolled away

contextId.information: Here "his head" refers to "Jesus' head." You can translate this in an active form. AT: "cloth that someone had used to cover Jesus' face" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: cloth that had been on his head

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "the disciples had locked the doors where they were" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the doors of where the disciples were, were closed

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "God will not forgive them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they are kept back

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "when they had locked the doors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: while the doors were closed

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "with Thomas whom we called Didymus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: with Thomas called Didymus

contextId.information: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "If someone wrote down all of them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If each one were written down
